title: As veteran writer Salim Khan recovers, Shah Rukh Khan says: ‘I am who I am because of Salim Khan’
description: In a touching tribute, Shah Rukh Khan reflects on his famous grandfather's legacy and the impact it has had on his career.
content:
A black-and-white photograph of two men in suitcases with the caption "Salman Khan's grandfather was a top British-era officer; father Salim Khan once earned just Rs 400 as an actor"

In a heartfelt tribute to his renowned grandfather, Shah Rukh Khan has shared his thoughts on how Salim Javed Khan, better known as Salim Khan, influenced him throughout his life. "I am who I am because of Salim Khan," says Shah Rukh in a statement published by Hindustan Times.

Salman Khan's grandfather was once described as a top British-era officer and later went on to become an actor with just Rs 400 per role. This modest beginning has shaped the career trajectory of his son, who is now one of Bollywood’s most recognizable faces.

In a recent update about Salim Khan's health, Shah Rukh Khan expressed concern for his grandfather and his family's well-being. The statement highlights how Salim Khan's resilience in recovery underscores the strength of the bond between generations. "My father has been through many adversities throughout his life," says Shah Rukh, emphasizing their shared experiences.

The family is pleased with how their patriarch has responded to medical support, with Salim Khan reportedly stable and receiving care at a specialist hospital. The public response to Salim's health update has shown great concern and support for the elder man recovering from illness.

Salman Khan’s grandson continues his father’s legacy by sharing stories of valor in films that have won him critical acclaim both domestically and internationally. Despite the immense admiration, the younger generation remains deeply connected to their roots through their father's words and actions.

This story serves as a reminder of how family dynamics can influence an individual's career path and personal development, especially within industries where talent is heavily influenced by nurturing and mentorship.
